title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributing to RPrelimEdaHelper
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to RPrelimEdaHelper
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to RPrelimEdaHelper
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/R_Prelim_Eda_Helper", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to RPrelimEdaHelper
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to RPrelimEdaHelper
text: Please note RPrelimEdaHelper project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: This package is a preliminary exploratory data analysis tool to make useful feature comparison plots and provide relevant information to simplify an otherwise tedious EDA step of any data science project
title: This package is a preliminary exploratory data analysis tool to make useful feature comparison plots and provide relevant information to simplify an otherwise tedious EDA step of any data science project
text: package preliminary exploratory data analysis (EDA) tool make useful feature EDA plots provide relevant information simplify otherwise tedious EDA step data science project. Specifically package allows users target two features, whether numeric categorical, create visualization plots supplemented useful summary test statistics. package provides streamlined easy use solution basic EDA tasks otherwise require significant amount coding achieve. R_prelim_eda_helper enables user write quick visualization queries. time, understand visually strong effects graphs necessarily statistically meaningful, prelim_eda_helper designed combine graphic visualizations preliminary statistical test results. aim create helper package really help researchers get quick sense data look like, without making charts tests separately earlier stages projects. existing packages plotting statistical tests already exist (e.g., ggplot2(https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/ggplot.html) tidyverse), believe combination graphical statistical output makes prelim_eda_helper unique yet handy helper package. achive goal, R_prelim_eda_helper creates charts visualization library ggplot2 conducts statistical tests ‘scipy’.

title: This package is a preliminary exploratory data analysis tool to make useful feature comparison plots and provide relevant information to simplify an otherwise tedious EDA step of any data science project
text: development version package can installed code .

title: This package is a preliminary exploratory data analysis tool to make useful feature comparison plots and provide relevant information to simplify an otherwise tedious EDA step of any data science project
text: Creates pair plots showing distribution numeric variable grouped categorical variable. Output includes histogram boxplot. addition, basic test statistics provided user reference.
code: num_dist_by_cat(   num = x, group = classes, data = data,   title_hist = 'Distribution of X', title_boxplot = 'X Seperated by Group',   lab_num = 'X', lab_group = 'Group', num_on_x = TRUE, stat = TRUE)

title: This package is a preliminary exploratory data analysis tool to make useful feature comparison plots and provide relevant information to simplify an otherwise tedious EDA step of any data science project
text: Creates scatter plot given two numerical variables. plot can provide regression trendline include confidence interval bands. Spearman Pearson’s correlation also returned aid user determining feature relationship.
code: num_dist_scatter(   num1 = 'num1', num2 = 'num2', data = df, title = 'num1 v num2',   stat = FALSE, trend = FALSE)

title: This package is a preliminary exploratory data analysis tool to make useful feature comparison plots and provide relevant information to simplify an otherwise tedious EDA step of any data science project
text: Creates concatenated charts showing heatmap two categorical variables bar chart occurrence variables.
code: cat_dist_heatmap(   cat1 = 'group1', cat2 = 'group2', data = df, title = 'Group1 & Group2 Distribution',    heatmap = TRUE, barchart = TRUE)

title: This package is a preliminary exploratory data analysis tool to make useful feature comparison plots and provide relevant information to simplify an otherwise tedious EDA step of any data science project
text: Creates distribution plot given numeric variable provides statistical summary feature. addition, correlation values variable numeric features provided based given threshold.
code: num_dist_summary(   col_name = num1, data = df, title = 'num_col1', label_x = 'distribution of num1',   thresh_corr = 0.0, stat = TRUE)

what:
Create concatenated charts showing the heatmap of two categorical variables and the barcharts for occurrance of these variables.
Heatmap will be on the left and the two barcharts will be on the right in the same column. — cat_dist_heatmap
title:
Create concatenated charts showing the heatmap of two categorical variables and the barcharts for occurrance of these variables.
Heatmap will be on the left and the two barcharts will be on the right in the same column. — cat_dist_heatmap
text: Create concatenated charts showing heatmap two categorical variables barcharts occurrance variables. Heatmap left two barcharts right column.

title:
Create concatenated charts showing the heatmap of two categorical variables and the barcharts for occurrance of these variables.
Heatmap will be on the left and the two barcharts will be on the right in the same column. — cat_dist_heatmap
code: cat_dist_heatmap(   cat_1,   cat_2,   data,   title = "",   heatmap = TRUE,   barchart = TRUE )

title:
Create concatenated charts showing the heatmap of two categorical variables and the barcharts for occurrance of these variables.
Heatmap will be on the left and the two barcharts will be on the right in the same column. — cat_dist_heatmap
text: cat_1 Name column name first categorical variable. cat_2 Name column name second categorical variable. data Target data frame visualization. title Title chart. heatmap Whether include heatmap plot . barchart Whether include barchart .

title:
Create concatenated charts showing the heatmap of two categorical variables and the barcharts for occurrance of these variables.
Heatmap will be on the left and the two barcharts will be on the right in the same column. — cat_dist_heatmap
text: concatenated ggplot chart consists heatmap 2 barcharts. @examples cat_dist_heatmap( cat_1 = school_type, cat_2 = program_type, data = data, title = 'School Type vs Program Type', lab_1 = 'School type', lab_2 = 'Program type', heatmap = True, barchart = True)

what: Create a histogram paired with a box plot. — num_dist_by_cat
title: Create a histogram paired with a box plot. — num_dist_by_cat
text: Create histogram paired box plot.

title: Create a histogram paired with a box plot. — num_dist_by_cat
code: num_dist_by_cat(   num,   group,   data,   title_hist = "",   title_boxplot = "",   lab_num = "",   lab_group = "",   num_on_x = TRUE,   stat = TRUE )

title: Create a histogram paired with a box plot. — num_dist_by_cat
text: num Name column numeric variable. group Name column categorical variable. data Target data frame visualization. title_hist Title histogram. title_boxplot Title boxplot. lab_num Axis label numeric variable. lab_group Axis label categorical variable. num_on_x Whether numeric variable put x-axis boxplot. stat Whether printing test statistic summary .

title: Create a histogram paired with a box plot. — num_dist_by_cat
text: ggplot object consists histogram boxplot. @examples data <- data.frame( num = c( 1, 2, 3, 4), classes = c( 1, 1, 2, 2)) num_dist_by_cat( num = num, group = classes, data = data, title_hist = 'Distribution X', title_boxplot = 'X Seperated Group', lab_num = 'X', lab_group = 'Group', num_on_x = TRUE, stat = TRUE)

what:
num_dist_scatter
Creates a scatter plot given two numerical features. — num_dist_scatter
title:
num_dist_scatter
Creates a scatter plot given two numerical features. — num_dist_scatter
text: num_dist_scatter Creates scatter plot given two numerical features.

title:
num_dist_scatter
Creates a scatter plot given two numerical features. — num_dist_scatter
code: num_dist_scatter(num1, num2, data, title = "", stat = FALSE, trend = FALSE)

title:
num_dist_scatter
Creates a scatter plot given two numerical features. — num_dist_scatter
text: num1 string name column first numeric feature. num2 string name column second numeric feature. data dataframe visualization. title string title chart. stat Boolean whether include simple statistics. trend string type trend line. Options : FALSE, 'lm', 'loess'.

title:
num_dist_scatter
Creates a scatter plot given two numerical features. — num_dist_scatter
text: ggplot scatter plot object @examples num_dist_scatter( num1='num1', num2='num2', data=df, title='num1 v num2', stat = TRUE, trend='lm' )

what:
Create a distribution plot of the numeric variable
in general and statistical summary  of the feature .
In addition, the  correlation values of the input
variable with other features based on a threshold will also be returned — num_dist_summary
title:

in general and statistical summary  of the feature .
In addition, the  correlation values of the input
variable with other features based on a threshold will also be returned — num_dist_summary
text: Create distribution plot numeric variable general statistical summary  feature . addition,  correlation values input variable features based threshold also returned

title:
Create a distribution plot of the numeric variable
in general and statistical summary  of the feature .
In addition, the  correlation values of the input
variable with other features based on a threshold will also be returned — num_dist_summary
code: num_dist_summary(   col_name,   data,   title = "",   label_x = "",   thresh_corr = 0.3,   stat = TRUE )

title:
Create a distribution plot of the numeric variable
in general and statistical summary  of the feature .
In addition, the  correlation values of the input
variable with other features based on a threshold will also be returned — num_dist_summary
text: col_name string  name column data dataframe , target DataSet visualization title string , Title chart , default ='' label_x string,  X-axis label numeric column thresh_corr Number Threshold value correlation stat Boolean, whether show statistic information

title:
Create a distribution plot of the numeric variable
in general and statistical summary  of the feature .
In addition, the  correlation values of the input
variable with other features based on a threshold will also be returned — num_dist_summary
text: plot dataframe display summary statistics correlation values @examples num_dist_summary( col_name =num1, data=df, title='num_col1',label_x= 'distribution num1', thresh_corr = 0.3,stat = TRUE )
